elements.title: Titanokorys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the relative rarity of the radiodont Titanokorys (video featured) in Marble Canyon suggests that the deposits in which it was found may represent the outermost edge of its distribution in life?

elements.title: Isa Hasan al-Yasiri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Iraqi poet Isa Hasan al-Yasiri ran away from school at 10 years old, before travelling with a camel caravan overnight to another village?

elements.title: Don't Forget (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a negative review of Sky Ferreira's "Don't Forget" on Pitchfork caused a large amount of controversy?

elements.title: Jon Morgan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Welsh footballer Jon Morgan went on to become a college principal after retiring?

elements.title: Guide to the Free World (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the founder of the Guide to the Free World, helping people leave Russia after its invasion of Ukraine, said she was told: "It's good that you get out of Russia, but a pity that you won't be shot"?

elements.title: Lafayette Cartee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after serving as the speaker of the Oregon Territory House of Representatives, Lafayette Cartee moved to the Idaho Territory where he became a well-known horticulturalist?

elements.title: NAFO (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Shiba Inu memes of NAFO have been called "an actual tactical event against a nation state"?

elements.title: a lettuce (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you could place bets on a lettuce becoming the British prime minister?
